name: Xisal_859793_Var02_r05_d06_a00_b03
description:
Xisal combines three separate periodic formulae, mappping each one onto a dot-matrix grid with separate ranges and offsets. Noise is taken from circular motion on a 2D noise field with its own radius and offset. These values are mapped onto a range of colours according to one of seven different algorithms, and rotation is added to produce interference patterns with a choice from eight rendering modes.
The initial seed for this loop of 120 frames is 859793, which selects function 0 with offset (-86.0, -2.0), range (6.0, -0.800004), and function 3 with offset (-12.0, -61.0), range (0.6, -6.3999987). Noise is produced from sampling points on an ellipse at co-ordinates (77.0, 16.0) with diameters (1.6000009, 0.9000007). The three formulae are combined using algorithm 5 with hue values starting at 67 with range 225. The grid is 75 units square.
